note.en:
‚öôÔ∏è **POR** and **PARA** are often translated as "for" or "by" in English, but their uses are very distinct in Spanish.

üîπ **POR is used for:**

1Ô∏è‚É£ **Cause, reason (because of, thanks to)**
‚û°Ô∏è *Lo hago por ti.* (I do it for you / because of you.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Por el mal tiempo, no salimos.* (Because of the bad weather, we don't go out.)

2Ô∏è‚É£ **Place of passage (through, by)**
‚û°Ô∏è *Paso por el parque.* (I pass through the park.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Viajo por Espa√±a.* (I travel through Spain.)

3Ô∏è‚É£ **Approximate duration**
‚û°Ô∏è *Voy por tres d√≠as.* (I'm going for about three days.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Estuve all√≠ por una hora.* (I was there for about an hour.)

4Ô∏è‚É£ **Means, agent**
‚û°Ô∏è *Hablo por tel√©fono.* (I speak by phone.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Enviado por correo.* (Sent by mail.)

5Ô∏è‚É£ **Exchange**
‚û°Ô∏è *Pagu√© 10 euros por el libro.* (I paid 10 euros for the book.)

6Ô∏è‚É£ **Common expressions:**
- *por favor* (please)
- *por ejemplo* (for example)
- *por supuesto* (of course)
- *por la ma√±ana/tarde/noche* (in the morning/afternoon/evening)

üîπ **PARA is used for:**

1Ô∏è‚É£ **Purpose, objective (in order to)**
‚û°Ô∏è *Estudio para aprender.* (I study to learn.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Este regalo es para ti.* (This gift is for you.)

2Ô∏è‚É£ **Destination (toward a place)**
‚û°Ô∏è *Salgo para Madrid ma√±ana.* (I'm leaving for Madrid tomorrow.)

3Ô∏è‚É£ **Recipient**
‚û°Ô∏è *Una carta para Juan.* (A letter for Juan.)

4Ô∏è‚É£ **Deadline**
‚û°Ô∏è *Es para el lunes.* (It's for Monday.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Necesito esto para ma√±ana.* (I need this for tomorrow.)

5Ô∏è‚É£ **Opinion (according to, for)**
‚û°Ô∏è *Para m√≠, es dif√≠cil.* (For me, it's difficult.)

6Ô∏è‚É£ **Comparison with expected norm**
‚û°Ô∏è *Para ser extranjero, habla muy bien.* (For a foreigner, he speaks very well.)

üí° **Tip to distinguish POR and PARA:**
- **POR** ‚Üí Cause, passage, means ‚Üí looks toward **past/present**
- **PARA** ‚Üí Purpose, destination, deadline ‚Üí looks toward **future**

üî∏ **Comparative examples:**
- *Trabajo por dinero.* (I work for money - cause/motivation)
- *Trabajo para ganar dinero.* (I work to earn money - purpose)

- *Paso por tu casa.* (I pass by your house - place of passage)
- *Voy para tu casa.* (I'm going to your house - destination)
